result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C. McGraw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael C. McGraw appeared in court. 
Assistant District Attorney James Fassbender: Present. 
Warrant quashed by the Court. 
Defendant wishes to waive his right to counsel and enter a no contest plea today. 
Waiver accepted by the Court after rights were explained. 
No contest plea accepted, defendant found guilty by the Court. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 12 months Probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- AODA assessment 
- early discharge after 6 months, if all conditions completed successfully 
Appeal rights were provided.

Call from defendant's finance.  he was arrested a few minutes ago and taken to shawano jail. Any way she can post money so he can be released for their wedding.  Judge authorizes him to post $150, provide current address and appear 4/5 at 1:30 ... jail advised.

ADA Veronica Isherwood, Present
Defendant: Nonappearance
Warrant Ordered 2:03 PM

ADA Veronica Isherwood, Present

  Bond continued.
Statements by ADA Isherwood.
Statements by defendant - unsure of what he should do - wants an attorney - defendant does not qualify for SPD - will be retaining his own attorney.
